questions.text: I need to fully understand how something works before I can use it effectively.
I prefer observing situations from a distance before getting involved.
I find that too much social interaction drains my mental energy.
I often feel I need more time alone to process my thoughts and ideas.
Knowledge and competence are more important to me than social connections.
I tend to minimize my needs and live simply to preserve my independence.
I feel anxious when I don't have enough information about a situation.
I would rather master one subject deeply than have surface knowledge of many.
I find myself detaching emotionally when situations become too intense.
I believe that understanding the world intellectually is the best way to navigate it.
I tend to question authority and want to verify information for myself.
I often imagine worst-case scenarios to prepare myself for potential problems.
Loyalty to my friends and commitments is one of my strongest values.
I feel most secure when I have a reliable support system around me.
I tend to second-guess decisions even after I've made them.
I am naturally skeptical of people's motives until they prove trustworthy.
I value being prepared and having contingency plans for important situations.
I find comfort in belonging to groups or organizations that share my values.
I take direct action when I see something that needs to be changed.
I have a strong sense of justice and will confront unfairness directly.
I naturally take charge in situations where leadership is needed.
I respect people who are direct and honest, even if it's uncomfortable.
I feel a strong need to protect those who are vulnerable or being treated unfairly.
I prefer being in control of situations rather than having others decide for me.
I am comfortable with confrontation and don't shy away from difficult conversations.
Showing vulnerability feels like weakness to me.
I feel deeply moved by art, music, or stories that express profound emotions.
I often feel like I'm different from others in ways that are hard to explain.
Authenticity and being true to myself are more important than fitting in.
I tend to dwell on past experiences and their emotional significance.
I am drawn to expressing myself creatively in some form.
